myFlix

Overview

Once opening this app, you can register an account or login to an existing one. Once logged in the program with route you to the movie screen where you can see a list of movies. From here you have the freedom to see information from any of the following movies, edit your account, or logout.

Objective

Using Angular, build the client-side for an application called myFlix based on its existing server-side code (REST API and database), with supporting documentation.

Tools

This project was started by building an api by using a REST architecture, getting all of our endpoints set up, and inputting all our information into MongoDB. It was written using the React library, styled using bootstrap, and hosted online through gh-pages.

Building the API

The first step for creating a REST API is to determine which requests are going to be necessary while using CRUD. CRUD stands for create, read, update, and delete. I made a list of all the different URL endpoints this application was going to use and I made a table to show all this information along with a function per endpoint for where the URL will take you. Before I went any further I tested each endpoint with Postman.

Database schema

MongoDB

I linked MongoDB to my profile after creating the API within their application. In there I added all the movies in the collection so the data could later be pulled from it to be presented in the myFlix project. I created a user initially to test the login then later optimized it so when people register it sends a post request to MongoDB and adds their user information to the user collection.

Two movies from the MongoDB API

App structure

Angular is a component-based JavaScript framework that is a good fit for this project. This project is going to be compromised of components. The first ones that got set up were the registration and login components. These two components interact with MongoDB to ensure that the information is permitted and authorized. Once myFlix sees that you're logged in and authorized it reroutes you to a movie screen where you can view all the movies. Each movie panel has a few buttons like description, genre, & director. For example if you click director then it looks into the information of that movie, finds that director, and pulls up a model with that director's name, bio, and birthdate. There is also a banner at the top that will allow the user to view and edit their profile information with read and update requests.

Ex: movie genre description

Reflection

The most challenging part of this project was integrating multiple technologies. I had a tough time initially being able to log in/register any users. I would use postman to create a user to login with and when I checked the console I kept getting errors or that it was having trouble connecting through heroku and MongoDB. To get through this problem I had to re-read their documentation and take it step by step a second time and look through my code to make sure everything was going right. Once it was fixed I was able to fix all other issues by troubleshooting them through the console and seeing exactly where it came from. I learned a lot working through this project, figuring out a lot of ways to work through a lot of different problems.
